page.title: 13THE CHILWELL GHOST
page.content: Ghost House Lane in Chilwell has been the site of a famous haunting. In 1843, a local handyman and his family living in a cottage called Ashflat House, Chilwell, claimed that he heard eerie bangings in the night. Nothing was ever found but several people witnessed the ghostly sounds. The haunted house became so famous that extra trains were put on to convey people to Chilwell. It was thought a Pedlar had been murdered by Mr. X and his body disposed of near the house. A blood-stained axe was recovered from a nearby brook some years later.
